game_number.sentence: Cutler was 24-of-33 on the afternoon for 358 yards with 2 scores.

defense_tackle_assists.sentence: Lance Briggs was all over the place with 14 tackles and a sack, but he jumped offsides with 6 minutes remaining in the 4.

1.comment: Kenny Vaccaro to the Saints' 2-yard line. A quick out to Brandon Marshall for 6 and a 2.point run by Matt Forte pulled the Bears within 8. but Chicago couldn't get the ball back with enough time. Cutler was 24-of-33 on the afternoon for 358 yards with 2 scores. He also ran for 27 yards on 4 carries.    The Bears' defense did a nice job of holding the Saints to field goals, but Chicago was unable to generate any takeaways. Vaccaro to the Saints' 2-yard line. A quick out to Brandon Marshall for 6 and a 2.point run by Matt Forte pulled the Bears within 8. but Chicago couldn't get the ball back with enough time. Cutler was 24-of-33 on the afternoon for 358 yards with 2 scores. He also ran for 27 yards on 4 carries.    The Bears' defense did a nice job of holding the Saints to field goals, but Chicago was unable to generate any takeaways. Lance Briggs was all over the place with 14 tackles and a sack, but he jumped offsides with 6 minutes remaining in the 4.h quarter on a 4.h-and-1 when New Orleans was probably not going to snap the ball. That allowed the Saints to drain more time off the clock and kick a field goal.    New Orleans' defense got good games from Curtis Lofton (9 tackles) and Jabari Greer, who did a good job defending Marshall. Aside from getting burned late by Jeffery, Vaccaro played well with 6 tackles and a sack.

player_team_score.sentence: Hightower ran over the Jaguars with 122 yards on 27 carries and 2 touchdowns.

opponent_score.sentence: Bortles was 27-of-35 for 368 yards with 4 touchdowns and 2 interceptions.

5.comment: Kenny Vaccaro intercepted the 2.point conversion to keep the lead at 31-19 for the Saints. The Jaguars' defense was incapable of restraining New Orleans' offense as they moved down the field before Hightower plunged into the end zone from a few yards out. New Orleans extended its lead to 38-19 early in the 4.h quarter. Late in the game, Bortles hooked up with Hurns for another touchdown and hit a 2.pointer to conclude the scoring.    Brees completed 25-of-36 for 412 yards with 3 touchdowns. It was vintage Brees as Jacksonville's defense was completely inept at defending him. Cooks had 5 catches for 123 yards and a score to lead the Saints receivers.    Hightower ran over the Jaguars with 122 yards on 27 carries and 2 touchdowns.    Bortles was 27-of-35 for 368 yards with 4 touchdowns and 2 interceptions. Generally, he played well, but the Jacksonville defense gave the offense zero support.    The Jaguars' dynamic receiving tandem of Robinson and Hurns continued to pad their stats. Robinson caught 6 passes for 151 yards and a score. Hurns had 8 catches for 106 yards and 2 scores.    There wasn't much defense in this game, and each team illustrated the need to upgrade its stop unit significantly to be any better in 2016.
